storyTitle: As Schedule Coordinator, I want to submit schedule change requests to achieve accurate and timely schedule updates

testCases.title: Validate successful schedule change submission with valid data
preconditions: User is logged in as Schedule Coordinator
User has necessary permissions to submit schedule change requests
Schedule change submission page is accessible
Test attachment file (PDF, 5MB) is prepared
Valid schedule data is available for testing

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change submission page
steps.expectedResult: Submission form is displayed with all mandatory fields including date, time, reason, schedule ID, and attachment upload section

steps.action: Enter valid schedule ID in the schedule field
steps.expectedResult: Schedule ID is accepted and field shows no validation errors

steps.action: Select a future date from the date picker
steps.expectedResult: Date is populated in correct format and accepted by the system

steps.action: Enter valid time in the time field
steps.expectedResult: Time is accepted in proper format (HH:MM) without validation errors

steps.action: Enter a valid reason for schedule change in the reason field (minimum 10 characters)
steps.expectedResult: Reason text is accepted and character count is displayed

steps.action: Click on attachment upload button and select a valid PDF file (5MB)
steps.expectedResult: File upload progress is shown, file is successfully attached, and file name is displayed with size information

steps.action: Review all entered data for accuracy
steps.expectedResult: All fields display entered data correctly without any validation error messages

steps.action: Click the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Request is accepted, confirmation message is displayed with unique request ID in format SCR-XXXXXX, and submission timestamp is shown

steps.action: Copy the request ID and verify it is unique
steps.expectedResult: Request ID is successfully copied and can be used for tracking

postconditions: Schedule change request is saved in ScheduleChangeRequests table
Request status is set to 'Submitted'
Request ID is generated and associated with the submission
Attachment is stored in the system
User is redirected to confirmation page or dashboard
Request appears in the user's submitted requests list

testCases.title: Verify rejection of submission with missing mandatory fields
preconditions: User is logged in as Schedule Coordinator
User has necessary permissions to submit schedule change requests
Schedule change submission page is accessible
All mandatory fields are identified: schedule ID, date, time, reason

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change submission page
steps.expectedResult: Submission form is displayed with all mandatory fields marked with asterisk (*) or 'Required' label

steps.action: Leave the schedule ID field empty
steps.expectedResult: Field remains empty without any data

steps.action: Click or tab away from the schedule ID field
steps.expectedResult: Real-time validation triggers and displays error message 'Schedule ID is required' in red text below the field

steps.action: Leave the date field empty
steps.expectedResult: Date field shows placeholder text but no selected date

steps.action: Leave the time field empty
steps.expectedResult: Time field remains empty

steps.action: Leave the reason field empty
steps.expectedResult: Reason field contains no text

steps.action: Attempt to click the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Submission is blocked, Submit button may be disabled or clicking produces no submission action

steps.action: Observe all mandatory fields
steps.expectedResult: All empty mandatory fields are highlighted with red borders and display specific error messages: 'Schedule ID is required', 'Date is required', 'Time is required', 'Reason is required'

steps.action: Verify a summary error message is displayed at the top of the form
steps.expectedResult: Error summary message displays 'Please complete all required fields before submitting' or similar message

steps.action: Verify the form remains on the submission page
steps.expectedResult: User remains on the same page with form data preserved and no navigation occurs

postconditions: No record is created in ScheduleChangeRequests table
Form remains in editable state
All validation error messages are visible
User can correct errors and resubmit
No request ID is generated

testCases.title: Ensure duplicate schedule change requests are prevented
preconditions: User is logged in as Schedule Coordinator
User has necessary permissions to submit schedule change requests
Schedule change submission page is accessible
Test schedule ID 'SCH-12345' is available
Test date and time '2024-02-15 10:00 AM' is available
Database access is available to verify request records

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change submission page
steps.expectedResult: Submission form is displayed with all required fields

steps.action: Enter schedule ID 'SCH-12345' in the schedule field
steps.expectedResult: Schedule ID is accepted and displayed in the field

steps.action: Select date '2024-02-15' from the date picker
steps.expectedResult: Date is populated and displayed correctly

steps.action: Enter time '10:00 AM' in the time field
steps.expectedResult: Time is accepted and displayed in correct format

steps.action: Enter reason 'Equipment maintenance required' in the reason field
steps.expectedResult: Reason text is accepted and displayed

steps.action: Click the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Request is accepted, confirmation message is displayed with unique request ID (e.g., SCR-001234), and success message appears

steps.action: Note the request ID and navigate back to schedule change submission page
steps.expectedResult: New blank submission form is displayed

steps.action: Enter the same schedule ID 'SCH-12345' in the schedule field
steps.expectedResult: Schedule ID is accepted in the field

steps.action: Select the same date '2024-02-15' from the date picker
steps.expectedResult: Date is populated in the field

steps.action: Enter the same time '10:00 AM' in the time field
steps.expectedResult: Time is accepted in the field

steps.action: Enter reason 'Additional changes needed' in the reason field
steps.expectedResult: Reason text is accepted

steps.action: Click the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: System rejects the duplicate request and displays error message 'A schedule change request already exists for this schedule and time period. Request ID: SCR-001234' in red text

steps.action: Verify no new request ID is generated
steps.expectedResult: No confirmation message or new request ID is displayed

steps.action: Query the database for schedule ID 'SCH-12345' with date '2024-02-15' and time '10:00 AM'
steps.expectedResult: Database query returns exactly one record with request ID SCR-001234, confirming no duplicate was created

postconditions: Only one schedule change request exists in ScheduleChangeRequests table for the specified schedule and time
Original request remains unchanged
No duplicate request ID is generated
User remains on submission page with error message visible
Form data is preserved for user to modify

storyTitle: As Schedule Coordinator, I want to save schedule change requests as drafts to achieve flexibility in submission

testCases.title: Validate saving and retrieving schedule change drafts
preconditions: User is logged in as Schedule Coordinator
User has necessary permissions to create and save drafts
Schedule change request form is accessible
ScheduleChangeDrafts table is accessible
No existing drafts for the test scenario

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change request form page
steps.expectedResult: Form is displayed with all fields empty and both 'Save Draft' and 'Submit' buttons are visible

steps.action: Enter partial data: schedule ID 'SCH-67890' in the schedule field
steps.expectedResult: Schedule ID is accepted and displayed in the field

steps.action: Enter date '2024-03-20' in the date field
steps.expectedResult: Date is populated and displayed correctly

steps.action: Leave time and reason fields empty intentionally
steps.expectedResult: Time and reason fields remain empty without triggering validation errors

steps.action: Click the 'Save Draft' button
steps.expectedResult: Draft is saved successfully, confirmation message 'Draft saved successfully' is displayed, and a draft ID is generated

steps.action: Note the draft ID or timestamp and navigate away from the form page
steps.expectedResult: User is able to navigate to another page or dashboard without data loss warning

steps.action: Navigate to 'My Drafts' or 'Saved Drafts' section
steps.expectedResult: List of saved drafts is displayed showing the recently saved draft with schedule ID 'SCH-67890' and save timestamp

steps.action: Click on the saved draft to open it
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change request form opens with the draft data pre-filled

steps.action: Verify schedule ID field contains 'SCH-67890'
steps.expectedResult: Schedule ID field displays 'SCH-67890' correctly

steps.action: Verify date field contains '2024-03-20'
steps.expectedResult: Date field displays '2024-03-20' correctly

steps.action: Verify time and reason fields are empty as originally saved
steps.expectedResult: Time and reason fields are empty, matching the original draft state

steps.action: Verify 'Save Draft' and 'Submit' buttons are available for further actions
steps.expectedResult: Both buttons are visible and enabled for user to continue editing or submit

postconditions: Draft is saved in ScheduleChangeDrafts table with partial data
Draft is associated with the logged-in user
Draft can be retrieved and edited by the same user
No validation errors are triggered on draft save
Draft remains in 'Draft' status and not submitted

testCases.title: Verify validation is bypassed on draft save
preconditions: User is logged in as Schedule Coordinator
User has necessary permissions to create drafts and submit requests
Schedule change request form is accessible
Mandatory fields are: schedule ID, date, time, reason
Validation rules are active for final submission

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change request form page
steps.expectedResult: Form is displayed with all fields empty and mandatory fields marked with asterisk (*)

steps.action: Enter only schedule ID 'SCH-11111' leaving all other mandatory fields empty
steps.expectedResult: Schedule ID is accepted, other fields remain empty

steps.action: Click the 'Save Draft' button without filling date, time, or reason
steps.expectedResult: Draft is saved successfully without any validation errors, confirmation message 'Draft saved successfully' is displayed

steps.action: Verify no error messages are displayed for missing mandatory fields
steps.expectedResult: No validation error messages appear, form shows success state

steps.action: Verify draft is saved by checking the drafts list
steps.expectedResult: Draft appears in 'My Drafts' section with schedule ID 'SCH-11111' and incomplete status indicator

steps.action: Retrieve the saved draft by clicking on it from the drafts list
steps.expectedResult: Form opens with schedule ID 'SCH-11111' pre-filled and other fields empty

steps.action: Without adding any additional data, click the 'Submit' button
steps.expectedResult: Submission is blocked and validation is triggered

steps.action: Observe validation error messages for missing mandatory fields
steps.expectedResult: Error messages are displayed: 'Date is required', 'Time is required', 'Reason is required' with fields highlighted in red

steps.action: Verify a summary error message appears at the top of the form
steps.expectedResult: Error summary displays 'Please complete all required fields before submitting' or similar message

steps.action: Verify the Submit button action is prevented
steps.expectedResult: No submission occurs, no request ID is generated, and user remains on the form page

postconditions: Draft remains saved in ScheduleChangeDrafts table with partial data
No record is created in ScheduleChangeRequests table
Validation errors are displayed on submission attempt
Form remains editable for user to complete required fields
Draft status remains as 'Draft' and not 'Submitted'

testCases.title: Ensure auto-save triggers every 2 minutes
preconditions: User is logged in as Schedule Coordinator
User has necessary permissions to create drafts
Schedule change request form is accessible
Auto-save functionality is enabled and configured for 2-minute intervals
Timer or clock is available to track 2-minute intervals
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change request form page and note the current time
steps.expectedResult: Form is displayed with all fields empty, current time is recorded (e.g., 10:00:00 AM)

steps.action: Enter schedule ID 'SCH-99999' in the schedule field
steps.expectedResult: Schedule ID is accepted and displayed in the field

steps.action: Enter date '2024-04-10' in the date field
steps.expectedResult: Date is populated and displayed correctly

steps.action: Wait for 2 minutes without any user interaction (do not click any buttons)
steps.expectedResult: After 2 minutes (at 10:02:00 AM), auto-save triggers automatically

steps.action: Observe for auto-save indicator or notification
steps.expectedResult: Auto-save notification appears briefly (e.g., 'Draft auto-saved at 10:02:00 AM' or spinning icon), confirming automatic save occurred

steps.action: Enter time '02:30 PM' in the time field after auto-save
steps.expectedResult: Time is accepted and displayed in the field

steps.action: Wait for another 2 minutes without clicking any buttons
steps.expectedResult: After 2 minutes (at 10:04:00 AM), second auto-save triggers automatically

steps.action: Observe for second auto-save indicator or notification
steps.expectedResult: Auto-save notification appears again (e.g., 'Draft auto-saved at 10:04:00 AM'), confirming second automatic save

steps.action: Navigate away from the form without manually saving
steps.expectedResult: User can navigate away without data loss warning since auto-save has persisted the data

steps.action: Navigate to 'My Drafts' section
steps.expectedResult: Drafts list displays the auto-saved draft with schedule ID 'SCH-99999'

steps.action: Open the auto-saved draft
steps.expectedResult: Form opens with all entered data pre-filled: schedule ID 'SCH-99999', date '2024-04-10', time '02:30 PM'

steps.action: Verify draft data contains the latest entered information including time field
steps.expectedResult: All fields display the most recent data entered before the last auto-save, confirming draft contains latest entered data

postconditions: Draft is auto-saved in ScheduleChangeDrafts table at 2-minute intervals
Latest form data is persisted without user manual action
Auto-save timestamp is recorded with each save
User can retrieve draft with most recent data
No data loss occurs if user navigates away
Auto-save does not trigger validation errors
